Key Match Events: RJ Barrett led the Raptors with 17 points before exiting due to a shoulder injury.
Chris Boucher contributed 13 points and six rebounds off the bench.
The Raptors opened a 13-2 run early in the game.
The Wizards cut the Raptors' lead to 15 in the third quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was the Raptors' pre-season opener in Montreal.
The Raptors conducted training camp in Montreal prior to the game.
Chris Boucher received a hero's welcome from the Montreal crowd.
Post-Match Reflections: RJ Barrett was evaluated for further tests after the injury.
Darko RajakoviÄ‡ highlighted the defensive performance and the win.
The Raptors' victory was a strong start to their pre-season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at the Bell Centre with a sellout crowd of 21,900.
The Wizards' coach Brian Keefe noted the impact of the Raptors' strong start.
Chris Boucher's dunk helped establish an early lead.
Others: The game was the Raptors' first pre-season game in Montreal since 2022.
The Raptors' next games include a rematch against the Wizards and a series against the Boston Celtics.
